name: Japanese Camellia
climate: Prefers a mild, temperate climate and does not tolerate extreme temperatures well.
Thrives in regions with high humidity and moderate rainfall throughout the year.
Cannot survive in frosty conditions or excessively hot and arid climates.
Ideal temperatures range from 15°C to 25°C for optimal growth.
sunlight: Requires filtered sunlight or partial shade to prevent leaf scorch.
Does not tolerate direct afternoon sunlight, especially in hotter climates.
Ideal for growing under taller trees that provide some filtered light.
Morning sun with afternoon shade is best for healthy blooms.
watering: Requires consistent moisture but should not sit in waterlogged soil.
Likes to be watered regularly, especially during dry spells and blooming season.
Ensure the top few inches of soil are kept slightly moist but not wet.
Avoid overhead watering to prevent fungal diseases on leaves.
soil: Thrives in well-drained, acidic soil with a pH ranging from 5.5 to 6.5.
Prefers rich, organic matter with ample nutrients for optimal growth.
Avoid heavy clay soils that retain too much moisture and reduce drainage.
Mulching can help retain soil moisture and keep the root system cool.
toxic: Leaves and flowers may cause gastrointestinal upset if ingested by pets.
extra_care_tip: Prune after flowering to maintain desired shape and promote air circulation.
Apply a layer of mulch in winter to protect roots from harsh cold.
